item.title: Report E-2024060055
item.description:
Report E-2024060055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 31, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN1487 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group to remediate the impacted site. TPM personnel deployed granular absorbents to the oxidizer-impacted dock floor and used a vacuum unit to remediate the site. All spent absorbents, and damaged product was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon vented drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024060119
item.description:
Report X-2024060119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was found leaking during the morning shift. Two admin handled the package and the contents got on their arms, causing a burning sensation. SCMS was entered, the Nurse line called, and their symptoms will be monitored. Upon being inspected during the PM sort, it looks like three of the bottles were dented and a leak resulted. The package was also sent without any markings- leaving it to be considered "Undeclared"
